H0.text: Which city was the capital of Italy from 1865 to 1871. Rome

H1.text: Which city was the capital of Italy from 1865 to 1871. Milan

H2.text: Which city was the capital of Italy from 1865 to 1871. Naples

H3.text: Which city was the capital of Italy from 1865 to 1871. פירנצה

A4.text: In 1871 the capital of Italy was moved from Florence to Rome.

A5.text: Rome then became the focus of hopes of Italian reunification after the rest of Italy was united as the Kingdom of Italy in 1861 with the temporary capital in Florence.

A6.text: Rome was declared the capital of Italy even though it was still under the Pope's control.

A7.text: the capital was moved from Turin to Florence.
